ygData.subject: Re: Wishful thinking
ygData.msgSnippet: lol, true :) I was just thinking about some of the trade items, though :) Makes sense... wouldn t a potter be proud of his accomplishment and perhaps sketch
ygData.messageBody:
lol, true :) I was just thinking about some of the trade items, though :) Makes
sense... wouldn't a potter be proud of his accomplishment and perhaps sketch his
initials in the bottom of the bowl before firing it? :) I dunno, was just a
random thought I had :)
-Rennin of E'Ci
Trade Council GM

"Whitcraft,David" wrote:

> From: "Whitcraft,David" <DWHITCRAFT@...>
>
> How true. I went to my mom's to 'fix' her pc. Word stopped working, printer
> wouldn't work, etc etc. Taking a look, she had <15 meg of disk space left.
> Heh...cleaned out her Deleted Items in her Inbox (just email trash). Now has
> 220 megs...and not a single email was over 1meg by itself.
>
> Yup...database changes can be huge. But size isn't normall the problem.
> Adding 100 gig of disk space for a large corporation isn't a problem.
> Puttnig the changing in the database is more the problem. Yer talkign about
> thousands of items...many thousands. And yer talking about touching every
> single one of them... Sure, you can write a script (depending on the
> database being used, you should be able to), but touching every single item
> in the game is DANGEROUS. Heh...
>
> -Zantaer/Leod, Fennin Ro
>
> htps://www.sok.org
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Nick Emmerich [mailto:seorin@...]
> Sent: Thursday, July 15, 1999 4:18 PM
> To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Wishful thinking
>
> From: Nick Emmerich <seorin@...>
>
> lol, if it got coded, I sure would have to laugh at the database :) I know
> from
> experience that lots of text (even if it's JUST text) takes up lots of space
> :)
> My e-mail trash is 40 megs =P No files, just text!!
> -Rennin of E'Ci
> Trade Council GM
>
> "Whitcraft,David" wrote:
>
> > From: "Whitcraft,David" <DWHITCRAFT@...>
> >
> > Sure it's possible to code! Wouldn't be a tough code, although the
> database
> > changes I bet would be horrendous! HA! A new member of the data structure
> is
> > EASY to put in, although changing all the data isn't always so easy....
> And,
> > I like the idea. Would be cool to see how much things get around. Like, I,
> > for the most part, don't remember who I bought my banded from.
> > Uumm...actually, I don't remember... Heh.
> >
> > -Zantaer
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Nick Emmerich [mailto:seorin@...]
> > Sent: Thursday, July 15, 1999 2:55 PM
> > To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
> > Subject: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Wishful thinking
> >
> > From: Nick Emmerich <seorin@...>
> >
> > Well, in the midst of all the flames, I wanted to make a friendly happy
> > sort of a post. Please, nobody argue with this, it would defeat the
> > entire purpose of this post. I won't even respond if this gets flamed,
> > and I would hope nobody else will either. Anyway, here goes:
> >
> > I just thought it'd be a neat idea to have 'name tags' on trade-made
> > products. Maybe not for cooking or brewing, as those items aren't meant
> > to last, but on generally anything else. Something in the status window
> > that says, "made by: name". Wouldn't that just be neat? Buy a banded
> > tunic 6 months from now with one of your secondary characters and say,
> > "hey! I made that!!" I'm not saying it's even possible for them to code
> > this, nor do I expect or really even want them to. I just think it's
> > kinda neat, that's all :) Too much coding for the effect it would
> > produce (or should I say lack of effect =P). Just, as I said, neat :)
> > -Rennin of E'Ci
> > Trade Council GM
